University of Virginia, Darden School of Business

MEMO OF UNDERSTANDING / SALES AGREEMENT
Parita Shah & Co. 
February 16-20, 2017

 

 

Please carefully read our company policies listed below. It is your responsibility to inquire about and fully understand change and cancellation policies regarding your travel arrangements.

 

 

GROUND PACKAGE: $ 2,500 per person*

 

*Pricing for ground package is based on a minimum of 7 passengers.  

 

 

INCLUDED

  • 4 night accommodations in Cuba (in private housing)
  • Daily breakfast
  • Meals (as specified on the itinerary)
  • Full time, professional, travel curator
  • Local ground transportation
  • Pre-trip departure information
  • Cuban Insurance (health and evacuation)
  • Cuban Visa
  • Compliance with U.S. Treasury Department regulations
  • Speaker fees
  • Admission to all museums and public buildings listed in itinerary
  • Coordination of all listed activities

 

NOT INCLUDED

  • Roundtrip airfare  
  • Airline baggage fees
  • Meals other than listed on itinerary
  • Individual house/hotel expenses (mini bar, room service, laundry fees, etc.)
  • Tips to Local Guides (varies depending on group size)

 

 

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

 

PAYMENT:

  • A deposit of $1,000 per person is due by 110 days prior to departure: October 26, 2016.
  • Full payment will be due 80 days prior to departure: November 26, 2016.
  • A signed copy of the Memorandum of Understanding should be turned in with the deposit.
  • Please inquire if you are interested in purchasing trip insurance from a certified, third party.

 

Payment can be made with a check, cashier’s check, or money order. Credit cards are not accepted. Checks should be made out to Cuba Educational Travel and mailed to:

 

Cuba Educational Travel

Attn: Parita Shah & Co.

72 Highland Avenue

West Islip, NY 11795

 

CANCELLATION and REPLACEMENT POLICIES:

  • The sale is final.
  • Cancellations made before 110 days prior to the trip are eligible for a full refund.
  • Cancellations made 109-76 days prior to trip departure are eligible for a 50 percent refund.
  • Cancellations made within 75 days of trip departure are not eligible for a refund.
  • In some instances, time permitting, a different traveler can take the place of a scheduled participant for a processing fee of $350.

 

UNUSED SERVICES & REFUNDS:

No refund or adjustment can be made for any portion of the services not used such as voluntary non-usage of hotel accommodations, scheduled meals or any planned activity described in your itinerary.

 

PASSPORT AND VISA:

All travelers are required to carry a valid passport and a Cuban visa. The visa will be completed by a Cuba Educational Travel representative and given to participants at check-in at the airport OR sent to the trip leader beforehand.

 

IMPORTANT:

Those without a valid passport will not be allowed to enter. Passport should be valid for a minimum of 6 months after departure date. Passports must be U.S. issued. Foreign passports allowed only in conjunction with a valid visa or U.S. Resident Alien card (Green Card) or valid U.S. visa. Cuba Educational Travel is not responsible for lost or stolen passports in Cuba.

For the last 1.5 years, Michael and I have been in Havana, building a life and a travel business in an island steeped in culture, intellect, and vexing BGIE questions. This is the society that seduced Hemingway, and nurtured the sounds of the Buena Vista Social Club—a society with a functioning ration card system, high quality universal healthcare, and no advertising. In early December, 3G arrived to our mobile phones. Change is afoot, yet the Cuban spirit feels unwavering.

 

We are eager to share with our HBS community the intricacies of Cuba at this particular moment in time. We hope you will join us for this 3-day journey, to hear from Cuba’s leading thinkers, ride in restored classic cars, see premier performances of dance and music, and feel the rhythm of Havana today.

 

Please contact Megumi (megumi@habanalive.com) or Vivian (vivian@cubaeducationaltravel.com) with any questions.
